com.esri.mo2.svr.map
Class OverviewMap

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.svr.map.OverviewMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
OverviewMap
public class OverviewMap
extends Object
implements OverviewMap

This class displays one or more layers on a Map at a larger extent compared with the Map. You can choose which Map Layers to show in the OverviewMap by using one of the OverviewMap's addLayer methods. These Layers must already be in the Map - if you remove them from the Map, then they are automatically removed from the OverviewMap.If you add a layer without setting up the Map object first, the layer name will be kept in a deposit and the OverviewMap's getLayer method will return a null if you try to get the layer with the layer's name. And the layer will be added to the OverviewMap when you set the Map object late but .

The current extent of the Map is normally shown as a half transparent red colored rectangular frame. You can change the color using the setRectangleFillColor and setRectangleOutlineColor methods.

If you zoom the Map past a certain threshhold, then the OverviewMap will also zoom so that the Map's zoom frame will always fill an area of the OverviewMap that can be readily seen. The threshhold is governed by the ZoomFactor property which is normally set a 4 times, and can be set as low as 2 times. This number represents the relative size of the Map's extent shown on the OverviewMap.

Before you can use an OverviewMap object, you need to call the setMap method to associate it with a Map. Also the OverviewMap should draw after server Map in a layout setting that could be accomplished by adding OverviewMapElement first before adding MapElement.

setRectangleFillColor

public void setRectangleFillColor(Color color)
Set the fill color of the viewport rectangle using the given color. A default Alpha transparency value of 80 will be used together with the red,green,blue components of the given colour.

Specified by:
setRectangleFillColor in interface OverviewMap
Parameters:
color - the new fill color
See Also:
setRectangleFillColor(java.awt.Color,int)

setRectangleFillColor

public void setRectangleFillColor(Color color,
                                  int alpha)
Set the fill color of the viewport rectangle using the given color and transparency. The actual color used will be constructed using the red,green,blue components of the given color, together with the given Alpha transparency. If you want to specify your own transparency, use the other variant of setRectangleFillColor

Specified by:
setRectangleFillColor in interface OverviewMap
Parameters:
color - the new fill color
alpha - the new alpha transparency, must be between 0 and 255 inclusive
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if color is null or alpha is out of bounds

setZoomFactor

public void setZoomFactor(double factor)
Sets the zoom factor this overview map. The default zoom factor is four and any value less than 2 is ignored.

public void addLayer(String layerName)
finds the layer in the Map and adds it if the layer exists in the Map. If not exists, schedules the layer to be added at a later time, if and when the layer is ever added to the Map.
